intro: Galium ciliatum var. weddellianum, commonly known as the Weddellian bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by slender, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves with ciliate margins. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the bedstraw genus, with specific adaptations to its ecological niche.
